Questions refer to the following passage: irds used to travel from one place to another. They travel to the southern warmer lands from northern regions of Asia, Europe and America during the autumn and carly winter, During the spring and early summer, they return as they do not get delay till the bad weather. During their travelling they face sufferings through the air, over the hills, forests, and plains, Sudden storms drive them far out of course. Bright lights at night attract and confuse them as well. T'hey cannot fly as fast as they could. Their migration speed is from 48 to 64km an hour and can exceed 80 too. 17.1. When do the birds travel from the southern to the northern regions?
